sections.name: Norgorberite Spy
sections.text: This creature did not include a description.

traits.name: Evil
traits.text: Evil effects often manipulate energy from evil-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to good divine servants or divine servants of good deities. A creature with this trait is evil in alignment.

traits.name: Human
traits.text: A creature with this trait is a member of the human ancestry. Humans are a diverse array of people known for their adaptability. An ability with this trait can be used or selected only by humans.

traits.name: Humanoid
traits.text: Humanoid creatures reason and act much like humans. They typically stand upright and have two arms and two legs.

interaction_abilities.name: Ranged Feint
interaction_abilities.text: When the Norgorberite spy successfully Feints a creature, the target is flat-footed against the spy's ranged attacks as well as melee attacks.

gear.name: one spy carries a greater cognitive mutagen and the other carries a vial of slumber wine
but the labels on each are switched.

automatic_abilities.name: Reaper's Protection
automatic_abilities.trigger: The spy is about to attempt a saving throw
automatic_abilities.effect: The spy touches their religious symbol of Norgorber and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to the triggering save.

traits.name: Manipulate
traits.text: You must physically manipulate an item or make gestures to use an action with this trait. Creatures without a suitable appendage can’t perform actions with this trait. Manipulate actions often trigger reactions.

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Versatile
traits.text: A versatile weapon can be used to deal a different type of damage than its listed type. This trait indicates the alternate damage type. For instance, a piercing weapon with versatile S can deal piercing or slashing damage. You choose the damage type each time you attack.

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Thrown
traits.text: You can throw this weapon as a ranged attack; it is a ranged weapon when thrown. You add your Strength modifier to damage as you would for a melee weapon. When this trait appears on a melee weapon, it also includes the range increment. Ranged weapons with this trait use the range increment in the weapon’s Range entry.

traits.name: Versatile
traits.text: A versatile weapon can be used to deal a different type of damage than its listed type. This trait indicates the alternate damage type. For instance, a piercing weapon with versatile S can deal piercing or slashing damage. You choose the damage type each time you attack.

ability.name: Quick Draw
ability.text: The Norgorberite spy Interacts to draw a weapon, then Strikes with that weapon.

ability.name: Sneak Attack
ability.text: The Norgorberite spy deals an additional 4d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures or creatures within reach of at least two of their allies.

universal_monster_ability.name: Sneak Attack
universal_monster_ability.text: When the monster Strikes a creature that has the flat-footed condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

ability.name: Surprise Attack
ability.text: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are flat-footed to the Norgorberite spy
